category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: Summary: desk research, interviews, survey, consultation (initial)
result.description: A concise summary capturing the actions taken concerning desk research, interviews, and consultations conducted in WP4. It provides a snapshot of expert insights across domains of TWGs, the evolution of Digital Partnerships, and the evidence-based materials shaping the Opportunity Report. The document also points to major findings from the surveys, key topics of interest for public consultations, and offers a glance at the preliminary feedback on Panorama and Opportunity Reports. The report will be developed initially at M12, and updated every 12 months (M24, M36).

result.title: One summary Panorama report (1 report/Cluster with 4 partners country reports combined)
result.description: The panorama report describes state of matters, R&D directions, strengths and weaknesses related to the TWG topics, covering Europe and the 4 Asian countries. It combines cluster level reports to be provided by each cluster leader. These reports are built using the TWG factsheets and include a cluster level synthesis for Europe and each of the Asian countries. This panorama report will be used in consultation session.

result.title: Community Platform - public summary (initial)
result.description: This deliverable presents the initial version of the INPACE platform: its detailed features, targeted audience and how users are engaged in the tool. It also provides usage statistics, which will be also consolidated in D5.2. The platform user guide (by EG) and summary and guidance about the InfoAsset use by people registered on the platform (by ATC) will be provided in annex of this document.

category.title: EU research policy /Research policies in the EU

result.title: Communication, Dissemination, and Outreach Plan
result.description: "Scientific manuscripts: 3 manuscripts in international journals. Scientific conferences: AGU, EGU, GRC (Gordon Research Conference), ICGH (Intl. conf. on gas hydrates)Project website,social media, et al: Progress and results in the form of info-metrics, animations, podcasts, and short blog-style articles will be regularly posted on dedicated website as well as social media.Animations and video blogs: Based on our models, methods and simulations, we will produce educational videos and animations that will be hosted on the project website, social media, and you-tube.Press releases: We will use online and print open-science-communication media like THINK magazine of UoM and local and national newspapers.Science festivals: For broadest possible engagement, we will organise presentations and exhibitions during UoM Open Week, European Researchers Night, and Long Night of Sciences across different cities.European Parliament Intergroups: Our findings will be of particular interest to the European Parliament Intergroup on""Climate Change, Biodiversity and Sustainable Development"". We will organise events and get in direct contact with the policy makers and the stake-holders"

result.title: Communication, Dissemination & Exploitation Plan
result.description: The plan describes the planned measures to maximize the impact of the project, including the dissemination and exploitation measures that are planned, and the target group(s) addressed. Regarding communication measures and public engagement strategy, the aim is to inform and reach out to society and show the activities performed, and the use and the benefits the project will have for citizens

category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: The Data Management Plan describes the data management life cycle for all data sets that will be collected, processed or generated by the action. It is a document describing what data will be collected, processed or generated and following what methodology and standards, whether and how this data will be shared and/or made open, and how it will be curated and preserved.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: Throughout the project, various data outputs of interest to a broad scientific audience, IR spectra and XPS data for unreported metastable metal oxides will be regularly deposited on public databases such as ICDD, PubMed or NIST. In addition, the databases of results, the mathematical algorithms and experimental protocols developed will be deposited in open access and peer-reviewed databases such as Data in Brief and MethodsX.In case of relevant results, the realization of patents will be considered, and later on, the industrial viability will be considered by signing transfer contracts with interested companies. In that case, after agreement with the companies involved, the results will be published in open literature. The preparation of patents will be supervised by Dr. Patricia Concepcion who has strong experience in the generation of patents and also the ITQ/CSIC/UPV have a patent management area. All scientific production will be included in the institutional repository (Riunet-UPV) as stipulated in the regulation of ITQ (UPV-CSIC).ADVCATALNANOMAT will practice early open sharing of research results through the ChemRxiv preprint repository. ADVCATALNANOMAT is also committed to submitting its early-stage non-patentable research to open review, believing that this can contribute to improving the quality of the final publication. In this sense, open peer review platforms such as The Winnower or Copernicus Publications will be used. All scientific production will be included in the institutional repository of the Polytechnic University of Valencia (Riunet-UPV). Finally, the most relevant results will be published in open access high-impact journals.

project.title: Design of efficient catalytic nanomaterials as a pillar of a sustainable economy

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
